intro: Streptanthus breweri, commonly known as the Brewer's streptanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
